title: Sandbags, Bomb Shelters On Crimea Beaches After Deadly Missile Strike
content: Tourists thronging the Black Sea beaches of the Russian-annexed Crimean peninsula this summer share the space with a grim new arrival: bomb shelters and sandbags.
summary: Tourists thronging the Black Sea beaches of the Russian-annexed Crimean peninsula this summer share the space with a grim new arrival: bomb shelters and sandbags.

title: "Disgrace": Greece's Main Opposition Party Slams 6-Day Working Week
content: Greece's main opposition party Syriza said Tuesday that the recent introduction of a six-day working week for certain companies was a "disgrace".
summary: Greece's main opposition party Syriza said Tuesday that the recent introduction of a six-day working week for certain companies was a "disgrace".

title: Plane Mechanic In Iran Dies After Getting Sucked Into Boeing Jet's Engine
content: The incident happened when local technician Abolfazl Amiri was pulled into the engine of a Boeing passenger jet while performing routine maintenance work.
summary: The incident happened when local technician Abolfazl Amiri was pulled into the engine of a Boeing passenger jet while performing routine maintenance work.

title: AI Startup Funding More Than Doubles in Q2, Crunchbase Data Shows
content: Overall startup funding grew 16% sequentially to touch $79 billion in the last quarter, primarily driven by investments in AI, which became the largest sector for the first time, followed by healthcare and biotech.
summary: Overall startup funding grew 16% sequentially to touch $79 billion in the last quarter, primarily driven by investments in AI, which became the largest sector for the first time, followed by healthcare and biotech.

title: "I Am Back": Slovak PM Returns To Work 2 Months After Shooting Incident
content: Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico said he had returned to work on Tuesday, almost two months after a lone gunman had shot him four times on May 15.
summary: Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico said he had returned to work on Tuesday, almost two months after a lone gunman had shot him four times on May 15.

title: New Research Shows AI Can Help Fight Breast Cancer
content: The research shows Artificial Intelligence (AI) can help fight breast cancer. Early and accurate diagnosis can be pivotal for treatment amongst patients, and a newly developed AI system promises to do so with near perfect diagnosis.
summary: The research shows Artificial Intelligence (AI) can help fight breast cancer. Early and accurate diagnosis can be pivotal for treatment amongst patients, and a newly developed AI system promises to do so with near perfect diagnosis.

title: Israel's "Targeted Starvation Campaign" Causing Gaza Children Deaths: UN
content: UN rights experts on Tuesday accused Israel of carrying out a "targeted starvation campaign" that has resulted in the deaths of children in Gaza.
summary: UN rights experts on Tuesday accused Israel of carrying out a "targeted starvation campaign" that has resulted in the deaths of children in Gaza.

title: UK Resolves Rwanda Asylum Cases After New Labour Government Drops Policy
content: Three asylum seekers who brought court action to block the UK's attempt to send them to Rwanda had their cases resolved on Tuesday, after the incoming Labour government ditched the policy.
summary: Three asylum seekers who brought court action to block the UK's attempt to send them to Rwanda had their cases resolved on Tuesday, after the incoming Labour government ditched the policy.

title: As Iran Gets New President, Will It Change Its Stance On Nuclear Standoff?
content: The election of relative moderate Masoud Pezeshkian as Iran's president has lifted the hopes of Iranians yearning for social freedoms and better relations with the West, but few expect big policy changes.
summary: The election of relative moderate Masoud Pezeshkian as Iran's president has lifted the hopes of Iranians yearning for social freedoms and better relations with the West, but few expect big policy changes.

title: Brain-Eating Amoeba Kills Israeli Man, 25, After He Went Swimming On Beach
content: The Israeli man is thought to have potentially come into contact with the amoeba while swimming at Gai Beach on the shores of the Kinneret in northern Israel.
summary: The Israeli man is thought to have potentially come into contact with the amoeba while swimming at Gai Beach on the shores of the Kinneret in northern Israel.

title: Explained: How This Year Of Elections Is Going To Reshape Global Politics
content: Elections are taking place this year in countries home to almost half of the world's population, from Taiwan's general election in January to the U.S. presidential race in November.
summary: Elections are taking place this year in countries home to almost half of the world's population, from Taiwan's general election in January to the U.S. presidential race in November.

title: "Huge Disappointment...": Ukraine President Reacts To PM Modi's Russia Visit
content: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has reacted sharply to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's brief visit to Russia and his interaction with Russian President Vladimir Putin.
summary: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has reacted sharply to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's brief visit to Russia and his interaction with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Watch: Major Bridge In New York Stuck Open After Getting Too Hot
content: As a result, traffic was halted on the one-lane structure, leaving multiple vehicles without any option to cross into Manhattan.
summary: As a result, traffic was halted on the one-lane structure, leaving multiple vehicles without any option to cross into Manhattan.

title: Kyiv Children Hospital Was Probably Directly Hit By Russian Missile: UN
content: The United Nations on Tuesday said there was a "high likelihood" that the children's hospital in Kyiv suffered "a direct hit" from a Russian missile.
summary: The United Nations on Tuesday said there was a "high likelihood" that the children's hospital in Kyiv suffered "a direct hit" from a Russian missile.

title: Explained: Why RIPCartoonNetwork Has Become The Top Trend
content: A rumour that Cartoon Network is shutting down sent shockwaves across the Internet. So much so that the hashtag RIPCartoonNetwork became the top trend.
summary: A rumour that Cartoon Network is shutting down sent shockwaves across the Internet. So much so that the hashtag RIPCartoonNetwork became the top trend.

title: Explainer: Why Democrats Are Urging Biden To Step Out Of Presidential Race
content: Citing concerns about his health and ability to take on Donald Trump, prominent House Democrats have doubted Joe Biden's fitness for office and his chances of winning in 2024.
summary: Citing concerns about his health and ability to take on Donald Trump, prominent House Democrats have doubted Joe Biden's fitness for office and his chances of winning in 2024.

title: Dog Turns On Stove In US House, Apple HomePad Alerts Owners Of Fire
content: A pet dog's curiosity almost turned deadly for a family in the US after the family pet accidentally switched on the stove at night while its owners were asleep. The family was saved from disaster after their Apple HomePad sent them an alert.
summary: A pet dog's curiosity almost turned deadly for a family in the US after the family pet accidentally switched on the stove at night while its owners were asleep. The family was saved from disaster after their Apple HomePad sent them an alert.

title: Singapore's Hell Theme Park Dead Serious About Afterlife
content: Gory grottos with demons impaling sinners on stakes and people drowning in a pool of blood are not part of your average theme park experience.
summary: Gory grottos with demons impaling sinners on stakes and people drowning in a pool of blood are not part of your average theme park experience.

title: Most Cancer Patients Die Of "Cachexia", Not Cancer: Read Details
content: When tumours in cancer patients elevate levels of an immune system molecule called Interleukin-6 (IL-6), it can cause severe brain dysfunction, which leads to a lethal wasting disease called 'cachexia' in about 50 to 80% cancer patients, a study said
summary: When tumours in cancer patients elevate levels of an immune system molecule called Interleukin-6 (IL-6), it can cause severe brain dysfunction, which leads to a lethal wasting disease called 'cachexia' in about 50 to 80% cancer patients, a study said

title: "No Disruption" To Production Despite Workers Strike: Samsung
content: South Korean tech giant Samsung said Tuesday that production was not being disrupted despite a three-day general strike by thousands of workers.
summary: South Korean tech giant Samsung said Tuesday that production was not being disrupted despite a three-day general strike by thousands of workers.
